Kim Jong Il's Work Brought Out in Mongolia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Brought Out in Mongolia 
   Pyongyang, January 19 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il's famous work "Socialism Is What Keeps Our People Alive" was brought out in booklet by a publishing house of Mongolia on Jan. 15.
 The work published on Nov. 14, Juche 81 (1992) underscores the need to preserve the world socialist movement and the cause of socialism and the tasks and ways for defending and advancing the cause of socialism.

Korean People's Greatest Holidays to Be Commemorated in Russia
articles.content:
Korean People's Greatest Holidays to Be Commemorated in Russia 
   Pyongyang, January 19 (KCNA) -- The Preparatory Committee for Commemorating the Day of the Sun and February 16 of the United Confederation of Koreans in Russia was inaugurated on Jan. 15.
 The preparatory committee decided to hold diverse events including a meeting, book and photo exhibition and publish a special issue of the information bulletin Thongil with a view to widely introducing the greatness of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il to the Koreans in Russia during the period from Feb. 1 to Apr. 20.    
 An Hyang Jin, chairman of the United Confederation of Koreans in Russia, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee at the inaugural ceremony.

Gift to Kim Jong Il from Head of Iranian Foreign Ministry Delegation
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from Delegation of Iranian Foreign Ministry
   Pyongyang, January 19 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by the visiting delegation of the Iranian Foreign Ministry.
 It was handed by its Vice-Minister Mahdi Safari who is heading the delegation to Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on Friday.

DPRK, Iran Cooperate in Culture
articles.content:
DPRK-Iranian Cultural and Scientific Exchange Plan Signed
   Pyongyang, January 19 (KCNA) -- A 2007-2009 plan for cultural and scientific exchange between the governments of the DPRK and Iran was inked here on Friday.
 Present at the signing ceremony from the DPRK side were Mun Jae Chol, acting chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, its Vice-Chairman Jon Hyon Chan, and officials concerned and from the opposite side were members of the delegation of the Iranian Foreign Ministry headed by Vice-Minister Mahdi Safari and Iranian Ambassador to the DPRK Jalaleddin Namini Mianji.    
 The plan was inked by Jon Hyon Chan and Mahdi Safari.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Il from Egyptian
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from Egyptian
   Pyongyang, January 19 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by President of the Orascom Telecom Holding of Egypt Naguib Sawiris.
 The gift was conveyed to Vice-Premier of the DPRK Cabinet Ro Tu Chol by I.N.Shalaby who is heading the visiting delegation of the Orascom Telecom Holding of Egypt, on Friday.

articles.title: DPRK Vice-Premier Meets Egyptian Delegation
articles.content:
DPRK Vice-Premier Meets Egyptian Delegation
   Pyongyang, January 19 (KCNA) -- Vice-Premier of the DPRK Cabinet Ro Tu Chol met and had a friendly talk with a delegation of the Orascom Telecom Holding of Egypt at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Friday.
 On hand were Pak Myong Chol, director of the Korea Post and Telecommunication Corporation, and officials concerned.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Iranian Foreign Ministry Delegation
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Iranian Foreign Ministry Delegation
   Pyongyang, January 19 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a friendly talk with a delegation of the Iranian Foreign Ministry headed by its Vice-Minister Mahdi Safari at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Friday.
 On hand were Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Kim Yong Il and Iranian Ambassador to the DPRK Jalaleddin Namini Mianji.
